p.s: First of all has Shakespeare no relevance for todaystoday's young people, because they can't easily access the idea of Shakespeare, due to the difficult language and the archaic English.
Furthermore they are unmotivated to interpret Shakespeare, because it has no uses for their daily lifeslives and future work.
As well as that, they think that Shakespeare is boring, because Shakespeare is made to be played and not to be read.
As well as that the roles of the people have changed over the time, and also the society.
Even if you need to study poems, you could use other contemporary, modern poetry, which is a lot more easier to understand.
But on the other hand there are also many arguments why Shakespeare is still relevant today:
First of all remains the influence of Shakespeare in the English language, (he has created over 100 words and multiple sayings) and therefore is it still important to get to know him and his work.
As well as that are the topics like love, death, loneliness, he speaks about, still relevant today and students can easy ccenide with these topic themselfesthemselves.
A next argument for the use of Shakespeare's sonnets in class is the fact that he inspired multiple young artists and authors and that he is a role model for many.
even if you don't want to study English literaturliterature, Shakespeare is a great part of the English history and culture and therefore also still relevant today.
I think that Shakespeare has still a great influence on todaystoday's literature and culture, not only in literature but also in plays, sayings or general conversations.
It follows, that it is a must to read at least one works of Shakespeare in class.
The numbers of sonnets or plays students have to read or interpret could change on the level of English they have.
For example needs the A-level to read more of his work.
If students can't understand the archaic English it is neccessarynecessary to give them help with translations or extra vocabulary.
But it is important to show, that Shakespeare isn't boring or irrelevant.
